item.title: Another human poo in the lift, 22nd November
item.description:
Just a week after the last one, there’s another poo in the lift making it unusable if you have accessibility issues or children. There is also a puddle of urine in the corner of the stairwell between the first and second floor Please install the security doors ASAP so the junkies can’t use our block as a public toilet as they continue to do.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbey Street, Old Kent Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 56a Chesterfield Grove- Continued Flytipping, 22nd November
item.description:
Cardboard boxes is causing an obstruction on the pavement. The residents continues to flytip and I urge the council to do something as there is a continued blatant disregard for the law and the health and safety of pedestrians.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Chesterfield Grove, East Dulwich, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Block drain on a steep hill, 22nd November
item.description:
About 3/4 of the way up the hill. Drain blocked and covered in leafs. Causing water to run down the hill.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Willenhall Road, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light not working properly, 22nd November

item.title: The graffitied van and trailer has been parked on the street for weeks without moving, 22nd November
item.description:
This van and trailer has been parked on the middle part of Dumbreck Road for many weeks taking up resident spaces. The trailer is full of plants and trees this is encouraging foxes and stopping residents parking outside their own homes. It’s an eyesore and is covered in graffiti.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Westmount Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping Phineas Pett Road, 22nd November
item.description:
Hi there. Looks like the builder left the old boiler and building rubbish on the street. On the photo you can see a company name and serial number. Probably will help you the recognise them. https://www.paynes-heating.co.uk/ Thanks. Peter

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Phineas Pett Road, Eltham
